cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles ENE of Great Abaco Island and 210 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west across the northwestern Bahamas today, turning WNW and coming ashore along Florida’s east-central coast tonight, then crossing central/northern Florida Thursday and curving north into Georgia and the Carolinas by Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (roughly between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical-storm or hurricane watch is in effect for the west-central Florida coast at this time.
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Bonita Beach to Indian Pass, FL (includes Tampa Bay and Manatee County coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Florida Peninsula, including Tampa Bay and the west-central Florida coast, then the southeast U.S. coastline up through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–57 mph with higher gusts) are likely at Port Manatee beginning late Wednesday night, peaking Thursday morning–afternoon as the broad wind field sweeps across the peninsula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge is possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, especially around high tide Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with localized totals up to 8 inches could cause flash and urban flooding and renewed rises on the lower Manatee and related rivers.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous marine conditions (large swells, rough seas, rip currents) are possible.
